etymology.description: Phonetic: 才(才) (cái, "talent") + Semantic: 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = combination symbolizing preservation or continuation -> preserve
etymology.interpretation: In 存(存) (cún, "preserve"), 才(才) (cái, "talent") functions as the phonetic element, while 子(子) (zǐ, "child") provides a semantic suggestion of nurturing or preserving, which aligns with the idea of keeping or saving.

examples.chinese: 请把珍贵的信件存入保险柜(請把珍貴的信件存入保險櫃)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ zhēnguì de xìn jiàn cún rù bǎoxiǎn guì.
examples.english: Please store the precious letters in the safe.

examples.chinese: 他把时间存起来(他把時間存起來)，为了未来计划(為了未來計劃)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ shíjiān cún qǐlái, wèi le wèilái jìhuà.
examples.english: He saved up time for his future plans.
